component.name: Steam Library Manager
component.summary: The modern Depressurizer alternative for Linux — organize your Steam library like a pro

description.p: Steam Library Manager (SLM) is a powerful, Linux-native tool for organizing large Steam game libraries. Built as the modern alternative to Depressurizer with features Steam itself doesn't offer.

ul.li: Smart Collections with AND/OR/NOT logic — filter combinations Steam can't do

17 AutoCat types: Tags, Genre, Publisher, Developer, Franchise, Platform, User Score, Playtime, Playtime (HLTB), Features, VR Support, Release Year, Language, Steam Deck, Achievements, Curator, PEGI Age Rating
Hybrid Rule Groups with saveable templates and presets
Steam Curator recommendations with overlap scoring
Steam Store metadata, review scores, and PEGI ratings
8 platform parsers: Heroic (Epic/GOG/Amazon), Lutris, Bottles, itch.io, Flatpak, and ROM emulation with 16 emulators
Add non-Steam games to your library with one click
Cloud sync with conflict detection and automatic backups
Export to VDF, CSV, JSON, and Smart Collections
Database backup and restore with rotation
Profile system to save and restore complete configurations
Secure login via QR code or password with keyring + AES-GCM token storage
Fast startup with progressive loading — UI visible in under 3 seconds
AppImage self-update with atomic replace and rollback

description.p: Fully multilingual (English + German) with zero hardcoded strings.

screenshot.caption: Main window with category tree and game details

description.p: Initial stable release with 17 AutoCat types, Smart Collections, 8 external game parsers, cloud sync, and full English + German UI.
